evs.gui.windows
Class EVSMainWindow

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      evs.gui.windows.EVSMainWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
GUICommunicator, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class EVSMainWindow
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements GUICommunicator

The main window frame for the Ensemble Verification System. The window contains a tabbed pane into which further windows are embedded. TODO: create a local store of verification and aggregation units that is accessible from all GUI windows, so that local saves are always updating the same store without any need to coordinate between windows, i.e. removing the dependence on save order.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com
See Also:
Serialized Form

tempDir

protected static java.lang.String tempDir
The temporary directory. The directory "/statsexplained" is copied to here for an external web browser to view files that explain each metric.

runProjectsSilently

public static int runProjectsSilently(java.lang.String[] args)
Runs an array of projects silently, writing the graphical and numerical output for all of the verification and aggregation units within each project.

Parameters:
args - the command line array of paths to the EVS project files
Returns:
the status (one of SUCCESS or FAILURE)

showSaveProjectDialog

protected final boolean showSaveProjectDialog(boolean saveAs)
Shows a save project dialog. Does not actually write the project data to file, since the operation may be canceled. Specifying saveAs to be true allows an existing project to be saved with a new name.

Parameters:
saveAs - is true to save an existing project with a new name
Returns:
true if the operation was NOT canceled

clearProjectFile

protected final void clearProjectFile()
Clears an existing project file.

hasProjectFile

protected final boolean hasProjectFile()
Returns true if the project file exists, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the project file exists.

saveProject

protected final boolean saveProject(boolean write)
Saves the project data by sequentially calling local saves on each input window and, finally, writing the output to file if write is true. Writing of the project file is done in a separate thread.

Parameters:
write - is true to write the data
Returns:
true if the save was successful, false otherwise

setWindowLocation

protected static void setWindowLocation(java.awt.Component component)
Centers the input component relative to the main window.

Parameters:
component - the Component

updateAndShowLocalData

protected final void updateAndShowLocalData()
Deprecated. 

Displays updated data following a change in the selected verification unit. If local data are currently being edited, this will remove all local data. Deprecated, as the same functionality must be handled in VERIFICATION_A

updateProjectFile

protected final boolean updateProjectFile()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Protected access to writing objects. This may be required following an update in a verification unit that does not require iterative saving of data first (e.g. following allocation of a paired dataset).

Returns:
true if the objects were written
Throws:
java.io.IOException
